Common Cold.description: A viral infection of the upper respiratory tract affecting the nose and throat.
Common Cold.recommendations: Rest, stay hydrated, use over-the-counter cold medications for symptom relief.
Common Cold.when_to_seek_help: If symptoms last more than 10 days, fever exceeds 103Â°F, or symptoms worsen significantly.

Influenza.description: A contagious respiratory illness caused by influenza viruses that infect the nose, throat, and lungs.
Influenza.recommendations: Antiviral medications if started within 48 hours, rest, fluids, fever reducers.
Influenza.when_to_seek_help: If you have difficulty breathing, persistent chest pain, confusion, or severe vomiting.

COVID-19.description: An infectious disease caused by the SARS-CoV-2 virus affecting the respiratory system.
COVID-19.recommendations: Get tested, isolate from others, monitor oxygen levels, seek medical care if symptoms worsen.
COVID-19.when_to_seek_help: Difficulty breathing, persistent chest pressure, confusion, bluish lips, oxygen saturation below 94%.

Pneumonia.description: An infection that inflames the air sacs in one or both lungs, which may fill with fluid or pus.
Pneumonia.recommendations: Seek immediate medical attention. Antibiotics for bacterial pneumonia, rest, fluids.
Pneumonia.when_to_seek_help: This is a serious condition - seek medical care immediately if you have difficulty breathing.

Acute Bronchitis.description: Inflammation of the lining of bronchial tubes, which carry air to and from the lungs.
Acute Bronchitis.recommendations: Rest, fluids, cough suppressants, avoid irritants like smoke.
Acute Bronchitis.when_to_seek_help: If cough lasts more than 3 weeks, you cough up blood, have high fever, or severe shortness of breath.

Asthma.description: A chronic condition affecting airways in the lungs, causing breathing difficulties.
Asthma.recommendations: Use prescribed inhalers, avoid triggers, create an asthma action plan with your doctor.
Asthma.when_to_seek_help: If rescue inhaler doesn't help, symptoms rapidly worsen, or you can't speak in full sentences.

Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease.description: A chronic inflammatory lung disease that causes obstructed airflow from the lungs.
Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease.recommendations: Smoking cessation, bronchodilators, inhaled steroids, pulmonary rehabilitation.
precautions: Get vaccinated for flu and pneumonia
Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease.when_to_seek_help: If you experience sudden worsening of symptoms, severe breathlessness, or bluish fingernails.

Allergic Rhinitis.description: An allergic response causing cold-like symptoms triggered by allergens like pollen, dust, or pet dander.
Allergic Rhinitis.recommendations: Antihistamines, nasal corticosteroids, avoid known allergens, consider allergy testing.
precautions: Keep windows closed during high pollen days
Allergic Rhinitis.when_to_seek_help: If symptoms significantly impact daily life, don't respond to OTC medications, or you develop sinus infections.

Coronary Artery Disease.description: A condition where the major blood vessels supplying the heart become damaged or diseased.
Coronary Artery Disease.recommendations: Seek immediate medical attention. Treatment includes lifestyle changes, medications, and possibly procedures.
Coronary Artery Disease.when_to_seek_help: Seek emergency care immediately for chest pain, especially with sweating, nausea, or shortness of breath.

Heart Attack.description: A medical emergency where blood flow to part of the heart muscle is blocked, causing tissue damage.
Heart Attack.recommendations: CALL EMERGENCY SERVICES (911) IMMEDIATELY. Chew aspirin if not allergic while waiting.
precautions: Chew aspirin if available and not allergic
Heart Attack.when_to_seek_help: THIS IS A MEDICAL EMERGENCY - Call 911 immediately. Every minute counts.

Arrhythmia.description: A condition where the heart beats with an irregular or abnormal rhythm.
Arrhythmia.recommendations: Medical evaluation required, possible medication or procedures like ablation or pacemaker.
Arrhythmia.when_to_seek_help: If you experience fainting, severe chest pain, or prolonged rapid heartbeat.

Heart Failure.description: A chronic condition where the heart doesn't pump blood as well as it should.
Heart Failure.recommendations: Immediate medical care, medications, lifestyle changes, possibly devices or surgery.
Heart Failure.when_to_seek_help: Seek immediate care if symptoms suddenly worsen, you can't lie flat, or have severe breathing difficulty.

symptoms: sores on legs that wont heal
Peripheral Artery Disease.description: A circulatory condition where narrowed arteries reduce blood flow to the limbs.
Peripheral Artery Disease.recommendations: Exercise therapy, medications, lifestyle changes, possibly angioplasty or surgery.
precautions: Control blood sugar and blood pressure
Peripheral Artery Disease.when_to_seek_help: If you develop sudden severe leg pain, or a foot wound that won't heal.

Gastroesophageal Reflux Disease.description: A chronic digestive disease where stomach acid frequently flows back into the esophagus.
Gastroesophageal Reflux Disease.recommendations: Antacids, H2 blockers or PPIs, lifestyle changes, avoid trigger foods.
Gastroesophageal Reflux Disease.when_to_seek_help: If you have difficulty swallowing, unexplained weight loss, chest pain, or vomiting blood.

Peptic Ulcer Disease.description: Open sores that develop on the inside lining of the stomach or upper small intestine.
Peptic Ulcer Disease.recommendations: Medications to reduce acid, antibiotics if H. pylori infection, avoid NSAIDs.
Peptic Ulcer Disease.when_to_seek_help: If you vomit blood, have black or bloody stools, severe abdominal pain, or unexplained weight loss.

Irritable Bowel Syndrome.description: A chronic disorder affecting the large intestine, causing digestive discomfort.
Irritable Bowel Syndrome.recommendations: Dietary changes (low FODMAP diet), stress management, fiber supplements, medications for symptoms.
Irritable Bowel Syndrome.when_to_seek_help: If you notice blood in stool, unexplained weight loss, severe pain, or symptoms at night.

Inflammatory Bowel Disease.description: Chronic inflammation of the digestive tract, including Crohn's disease and ulcerative colitis.
Inflammatory Bowel Disease.recommendations: Anti-inflammatory drugs, immune suppressors, biologics, possibly surgery.
Inflammatory Bowel Disease.when_to_seek_help: If you have severe abdominal pain, heavy bleeding, high fever, or signs of dehydration.

Appendicitis.description: Inflammation of the appendix that requires emergency surgical removal.
Appendicitis.recommendations: SEEK EMERGENCY MEDICAL CARE IMMEDIATELY - Surgery is typically required.
precautions: Do not eat or drink anything
Do not apply heat to abdomen
Appendicitis.when_to_seek_help: THIS IS A MEDICAL EMERGENCY - Go to the ER immediately. Ruptured appendix can be life-threatening.

symptoms: sudden intense pain upper right abdomen
Gallstones.description: Hardened deposits of digestive fluid in the gallbladder.
Gallstones.recommendations: Medical evaluation, pain management, may require surgery (cholecystectomy).
Gallstones.when_to_seek_help: Seek immediate care if pain is severe, you have fever and chills, or yellowing of skin.

Gastroenteritis.description: Inflammation of the stomach and intestines, usually caused by viral or bacterial infection.
Gastroenteritis.recommendations: Stay hydrated with water and electrolyte solutions, rest, eat bland foods when able.
Gastroenteritis.when_to_seek_help: If you can't keep fluids down for 24 hours, see blood in vomit or stool, have high fever, or signs of severe dehydration.

Type 2 Diabetes.description: A chronic metabolic condition affecting how the body processes blood sugar (glucose).
Type 2 Diabetes.recommendations: Blood sugar monitoring, dietary changes, regular exercise, medication as prescribed.
Type 2 Diabetes.when_to_seek_help: If blood sugar is very high or low, you experience confusion, rapid breathing, or fruity breath odor.

Migraine.description: A neurological condition causing recurring severe headaches with sensory disturbances.
Migraine.recommendations: Rest in dark quiet room, pain relievers, preventive medications, identify triggers.
Migraine.when_to_seek_help: If headache is sudden and severe, accompanied by fever, stiff neck, confusion, or weakness.

Tension Headache.description: The most common type of headache, often related to stress or muscle tension.
Tension Headache.recommendations: OTC pain relievers, rest, stress management, massage, improve posture.
Tension Headache.when_to_seek_help: If headaches are frequent, increasingly severe, or don't respond to OTC medications.

Stroke.description: A medical emergency where blood supply to the brain is interrupted, causing brain cells to die.
Stroke.recommendations: CALL 911 IMMEDIATELY - Every minute counts. Note the time symptoms started.
precautions: Remember FAST: Face drooping, Arm weakness, Speech difficulty, Time to call 911
Do not give food or drink
Stroke.when_to_seek_help: THIS IS A MEDICAL EMERGENCY - Call 911 NOW. Treatment within 3 hours can prevent brain damage.

Epilepsy.description: A neurological disorder causing recurrent, unprovoked seizures.
Epilepsy.recommendations: Anti-seizure medications, medical management, lifestyle modifications.
Epilepsy.when_to_seek_help: Call 911 if seizure lasts more than 5 minutes, person doesn't regain consciousness, or has difficulty breathing.

Meningitis.description: Inflammation of the membranes surrounding the brain and spinal cord, can be life-threatening.
Meningitis.recommendations: EMERGENCY - Requires immediate hospitalization. Bacterial meningitis needs immediate IV antibiotics.
Meningitis.when_to_seek_help: THIS IS A MEDICAL EMERGENCY - Go to the ER immediately. Bacterial meningitis can be fatal within hours.

Multiple Sclerosis.description: A chronic disease affecting the central nervous system, disrupting communication between brain and body.
Multiple Sclerosis.recommendations: Disease-modifying therapies, physical therapy, symptom management, specialist care.
Multiple Sclerosis.when_to_seek_help: If you experience new or worsening symptoms, severe vision changes, or difficulty walking.

Parkinsons Disease.description: A progressive neurological disorder affecting movement, caused by loss of dopamine-producing brain cells.
Parkinsons Disease.recommendations: Medications to increase dopamine, physical therapy, possibly deep brain stimulation.
Parkinsons Disease.when_to_seek_help: If symptoms suddenly worsen, you have difficulty swallowing, or medications aren't working.

Anxiety Disorder.description: A mental health condition characterized by persistent, excessive worry and fear.
Anxiety Disorder.recommendations: Therapy (especially CBT), medication if needed, relaxation techniques, lifestyle changes.
Anxiety Disorder.when_to_seek_help: If anxiety significantly impacts daily life, you have panic attacks, or experience thoughts of self-harm.

Depression.description: A mood disorder causing persistent feelings of sadness and loss of interest.
Depression.recommendations: Therapy (CBT, interpersonal), medication if needed, support groups, lifestyle changes.
Depression.when_to_seek_help: Seek immediate help if having thoughts of suicide or self-harm. Call 988 (Suicide & Crisis Lifeline).

Panic Disorder.description: An anxiety disorder characterized by recurrent, unexpected panic attacks.
Panic Disorder.recommendations: Therapy (especially CBT), medication, breathing techniques, avoiding triggers.
Panic Disorder.when_to_seek_help: First panic attack should be evaluated to rule out heart conditions. Seek help if attacks are frequent.

Bipolar Disorder.description: A mental health condition causing extreme mood swings including emotional highs (mania) and lows (depression).
Bipolar Disorder.recommendations: Mood stabilizers, psychotherapy, consistent routine, support system.
Bipolar Disorder.when_to_seek_help: If experiencing suicidal thoughts, severe mania, or psychotic symptoms.

symptoms: same joints affected on both sides
Rheumatoid Arthritis.description: An autoimmune disease causing chronic inflammation of the joints.
Rheumatoid Arthritis.recommendations: Disease-modifying drugs (DMARDs), biologics, physical therapy, lifestyle changes.
Rheumatoid Arthritis.when_to_seek_help: If joints become hot, severely swollen, you have fever, or new symptoms develop.

Osteoarthritis.description: The most common form of arthritis, caused by wear and tear of joint cartilage.
Osteoarthritis.recommendations: Pain management, physical therapy, weight management, possibly joint replacement.
Osteoarthritis.when_to_seek_help: If joint pain significantly limits activities, or you have sudden severe pain or swelling.

Fibromyalgia.description: A chronic condition characterized by widespread musculoskeletal pain and fatigue.
Fibromyalgia.recommendations: Medications, physical therapy, stress management, regular exercise, sleep improvement.
precautions: Stay active but don't overdo it
Fibromyalgia.when_to_seek_help: If symptoms significantly impact quality of life or new symptoms develop.

Gout.description: A form of arthritis caused by excess uric acid crystallizing in the joints.
Gout.recommendations: Anti-inflammatory medications, uric acid-lowering drugs, dietary changes.
Gout.when_to_seek_help: If you have severe joint pain with fever, or if attacks become more frequent.

Osteoporosis.description: A condition where bones become weak and brittle due to loss of bone density.
Osteoporosis.recommendations: Calcium and vitamin D supplements, medications, weight-bearing exercise, fall prevention.
Osteoporosis.when_to_seek_help: If you suspect a fracture, have sudden severe back pain, or significant height loss.

Urinary Tract Infection.description: An infection in any part of the urinary system - kidneys, bladder, ureters, or urethra.
Urinary Tract Infection.recommendations: Antibiotics (prescribed by doctor), increased fluid intake, urinating frequently.
precautions: Urinate when you feel the need
Urinary Tract Infection.when_to_seek_help: If you have fever, back pain, nausea/vomiting, or symptoms don't improve in 2-3 days.

symptoms: severe pain in side and back
Kidney Stones.description: Hard deposits of minerals and salts that form inside the kidneys.
Kidney Stones.recommendations: Pain management, hydration, may require medical procedures for larger stones.
precautions: Drink plenty of water (2-3 liters daily)
Avoid stone-forming foods depending on type
Kidney Stones.when_to_seek_help: Seek immediate care if pain is severe, you have fever and chills, blood in urine, or difficulty urinating.

Chronic Kidney Disease.description: Gradual loss of kidney function over time, affecting the body's ability to filter waste.
Chronic Kidney Disease.recommendations: Manage underlying conditions, dietary changes, medications, possibly dialysis or transplant.
Chronic Kidney Disease.when_to_seek_help: If you experience severe swelling, difficulty breathing, confusion, or very little urination.

Eczema.description: A chronic skin condition causing dry, itchy, and inflamed skin.
Eczema.recommendations: Moisturizers, topical corticosteroids, avoiding triggers, gentle skin care.
Eczema.when_to_seek_help: If skin becomes infected (increased redness, pus, fever), doesn't respond to treatment, or significantly impacts daily life.
risk_factors: Family history of eczema, allergies, or asthma

Conjunctivitis.description: Inflammation of the conjunctiva (pink eye), can be viral, bacterial, or allergic.
Conjunctivitis.recommendations: Depends on cause: antibiotics for bacterial, antihistamines for allergic, supportive care for viral.
Conjunctivitis.when_to_seek_help: If you have severe eye pain, vision changes, sensitivity to light, or symptoms don't improve in a week.

Glaucoma.description: A group of eye conditions that damage the optic nerve, often due to high eye pressure.
Glaucoma.recommendations: Eye drops, oral medications, laser treatment, or surgery to reduce eye pressure.
Glaucoma.when_to_seek_help: Seek emergency care for sudden severe eye pain, headache, nausea, or sudden vision loss.

Mononucleosis.description: A viral infection (Epstein-Barr virus) causing extreme fatigue, often called 'mono' or 'kissing disease'.
Mononucleosis.recommendations: Rest (lots of it), fluids, pain relievers for fever and discomfort, avoid contact sports.
precautions: Avoid contact sports for several weeks (spleen risk)
Mononucleosis.when_to_seek_help: If you have difficulty breathing, sharp pain in left upper abdomen (spleen), or severe weakness.

Strep Throat.description: A bacterial infection of the throat and tonsils caused by group A streptococcus.
Strep Throat.recommendations: Antibiotics (required - strep won't go away on its own), pain relievers, rest, fluids.
precautions: Stay home until fever-free for 24 hours on antibiotics
Strep Throat.when_to_seek_help: See doctor promptly for diagnosis. Untreated strep can lead to rheumatic fever or kidney problems.

Lyme Disease.description: A bacterial infection transmitted by infected black-legged ticks.
Lyme Disease.recommendations: Antibiotics (earlier treatment is more effective), symptom management.
Lyme Disease.when_to_seek_help: See doctor promptly if you notice bulls-eye rash or symptoms after tick bite.
risk_factors: Spending time in wooded or grassy areas

Hepatitis B.description: A serious liver infection caused by the hepatitis B virus.
Hepatitis B.recommendations: Rest, adequate nutrition, monitoring, antiviral medications for chronic infection.
Hepatitis B.when_to_seek_help: If you develop yellowing of skin or eyes, severe abdominal pain, or signs of liver failure.

Vertigo.description: A sensation of spinning or dizziness, often caused by inner ear problems.
Vertigo.recommendations: Medications, vestibular rehabilitation therapy, Epley maneuver for BPPV.
precautions: Sit or lie down during episodes
Vertigo.when_to_seek_help: If accompanied by severe headache, fever, hearing loss, weakness, slurred speech, or difficulty walking.

Tinnitus.description: The perception of noise or ringing in the ears when no external sound is present.
Tinnitus.recommendations: Treat underlying cause, sound therapy, cognitive behavioral therapy, hearing aids if needed.
Tinnitus.when_to_seek_help: If tinnitus is sudden, in one ear only, accompanied by hearing loss, or causing significant distress.

Hypothermia.description: A dangerous drop in body temperature below 95Â°F (35Â°C), a medical emergency.
Hypothermia.recommendations: SEEK EMERGENCY CARE. Remove wet clothing, warm gradually, give warm beverages if conscious.
Hypothermia.when_to_seek_help: THIS IS A MEDICAL EMERGENCY - Call 911. Severe hypothermia can be fatal.

Heat Stroke.description: A life-threatening condition when body temperature rises to 104Â°F (40Â°C) or higher.
Heat Stroke.recommendations: CALL 911 IMMEDIATELY. Cool the person rapidly with any means available.
precautions: Apply cold water or ice packs
Heat Stroke.when_to_seek_help: THIS IS A MEDICAL EMERGENCY - Call 911 immediately. Heat stroke can cause organ damage.

symptoms: episodes of stopped breathing during sleep
Sleep Apnea.description: A sleep disorder where breathing repeatedly stops and starts during sleep.
Sleep Apnea.recommendations: CPAP machine, lifestyle changes (weight loss), oral appliances, possibly surgery.
Sleep Apnea.when_to_seek_help: If you snore loudly and feel tired even after a full night's sleep, or your partner notices breathing pauses.

Dengue Fever.description: Dengue fever is a mosquito-borne viral disease caused by the dengue virus, transmitted primarily by Aedes mosquitoes. It is common in tropical and subtropical regions and can cause severe flu-like symptoms.
Dengue Fever.recommendations: Rest, stay hydrated, and use acetaminophen for pain and fever relief. Avoid aspirin and non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs as they can increase bleeding risk. Severe cases require hospital care.
precautions: Eliminate stagnant water to prevent mosquito breeding
Avoid outdoor activities at dawn and dusk
Dengue Fever.when_to_seek_help: Seek immediate medical attention if you experience severe abdominal pain, persistent vomiting, bleeding, extreme fatigue, or restlessness, as these may indicate severe dengue.

Chikungunya.description: Chikungunya is a viral disease transmitted to humans by infected mosquitoes, causing sudden fever and severe joint pain that can be debilitating and last for months.
Chikungunya.recommendations: Treatment focuses on relieving symptoms with rest, fluids, and pain relievers like acetaminophen. Avoid aspirin. Joint pain may require long-term management.
precautions: Stay indoors during peak mosquito activity
Chikungunya.when_to_seek_help: Seek medical care if joint pain is severe and persistent, or if symptoms include high fever, severe headache, or signs of dehydration.
risk_factors: People with comorbidities like diabetes or heart disease

Malaria.description: Malaria is a life-threatening disease caused by parasites transmitted through the bites of infected Anopheles mosquitoes, primarily affecting people in tropical regions.
Malaria.recommendations: Antimalarial medications for treatment and prophylaxis. Seek prompt diagnosis and treatment to prevent complications. Supportive care includes fluids and fever reduction.
precautions: Take prophylactic antimalarials if traveling to risk areas
Malaria.when_to_seek_help: Seek immediate medical attention if you have fever, chills, or flu-like symptoms during or after travel to a malaria-endemic area.

Tuberculosis.description: Tuberculosis is a bacterial infection caused by Mycobacterium tuberculosis, primarily affecting the lungs but can spread to other organs.
Tuberculosis.recommendations: Long-term antibiotic treatment (6-9 months). Directly observed therapy to ensure adherence. Isolation until non-infectious.
Tuberculosis.when_to_seek_help: If you have a persistent cough lasting more than 3 weeks, unexplained weight loss, night sweats, or have been exposed to someone with TB.

Typhoid Fever.description: Typhoid fever is a bacterial infection caused by Salmonella Typhi, spread through contaminated food and water, causing high fever and gastrointestinal symptoms.
Typhoid Fever.recommendations: Antibiotics are the primary treatment. Hydration and nutrition support are essential. Vaccination is recommended for travelers to endemic areas.
Typhoid Fever.when_to_seek_help: If you have sustained high fever, severe headache, abdominal pain, or have traveled to an area with poor sanitation.

Hepatitis A.description: Hepatitis A is a viral liver disease caused by the hepatitis A virus, typically spread through contaminated food or water.
Hepatitis A.recommendations: Supportive care with rest, hydration, and nutrition. The vaccine is highly effective for prevention. Post-exposure prophylaxis available.
precautions: Wash hands after using the bathroom
Avoid close contact with infected persons
Hepatitis A.when_to_seek_help: If you develop jaundice, severe fatigue, or abdominal pain, or have been exposed to the virus.
risk_factors: Men who have sex with men

Hepatitis C.description: Hepatitis C is a liver infection caused by the hepatitis C virus, often becoming chronic and leading to serious liver problems.
Hepatitis C.recommendations: Direct-acting antiviral medications cure most cases. Regular screening for at-risk individuals. Liver function monitoring.
Hepatitis C.when_to_seek_help: If you have risk factors like drug use or blood transfusion before 1992, or develop symptoms like fatigue or jaundice.

Viral Fever.description: Viral fever is a common term for fever caused by viral infections, often with flu-like symptoms that resolve on their own.
Viral Fever.recommendations: Rest, hydration, over-the-counter pain relievers. Antibiotics are not effective as it's viral.
Viral Fever.when_to_seek_help: If fever persists more than 5 days, or if symptoms worsen like high fever or dehydration.

Swine Flu (H1N1).description: Swine flu is a respiratory disease caused by the H1N1 influenza virus, similar to seasonal flu but can be more severe in some groups.
Swine Flu (H1N1).recommendations: Antiviral medications, rest, fluids. Vaccination included in seasonal flu vaccine.
Swine Flu (H1N1).when_to_seek_help: If symptoms include difficulty breathing, chest pain, or severe dehydration.

Measles.description: Measles is a highly contagious viral disease causing fever and a characteristic rash, preventable by vaccination.
Measles.recommendations: Supportive care, vitamin A for children. Isolation to prevent spread.
Measles.when_to_seek_help: If symptoms include high fever, difficulty breathing, or confusion.

Mumps.description: Mumps is a viral infection causing swelling of the salivary glands, preventable by MMR vaccine.
Mumps.recommendations: Supportive care, rest, pain relievers. Isolation during contagious period.
Mumps.when_to_seek_help: If complications like meningitis or orchitis develop.

Rubella.description: Rubella is a contagious viral infection best known by its distinctive red rash, dangerous for pregnant women.
Rubella.when_to_seek_help: If pregnant and exposed, or symptoms in newborns.

Chickenpox.description: Chickenpox is a highly contagious disease caused by the varicella-zoster virus, causing an itchy rash.
Chickenpox.recommendations: Calamine lotion for itch, acetaminophen for fever. Vaccination prevents it.
Chickenpox.when_to_seek_help: If rash becomes infected, high fever, or in high-risk groups.

Hand-Foot-Mouth Disease.description: Hand-foot-mouth disease is a mild, contagious viral infection common in young children, causing sores in the mouth and rash on hands and feet.
Hand-Foot-Mouth Disease.recommendations: Supportive care, pain relief, hydration. Usually resolves in a week.
Hand-Foot-Mouth Disease.when_to_seek_help: If child can't drink fluids, high fever, or symptoms worsen.

Cholera.description: Cholera is an acute diarrheal illness caused by infection of the intestine with Vibrio cholerae bacteria.
Cholera.recommendations: Oral rehydration therapy, antibiotics, zinc supplements. Vaccination for high-risk areas.
Cholera.when_to_seek_help: Immediate if severe diarrhea and vomiting leading to dehydration.

Food Poisoning.description: Food poisoning is an illness caused by eating contaminated food, usually bacteria, viruses, or toxins.
Food Poisoning.recommendations: Hydration, rest. Severe cases may need medical attention.
Food Poisoning.when_to_seek_help: If symptoms persist more than 3 days, bloody stool, high fever, or dehydration.

Leptospirosis.description: Leptospirosis is a bacterial disease that affects humans and animals, caused by Leptospira bacteria.
Leptospirosis.recommendations: Antibiotics, supportive care. Prevention is key.
Leptospirosis.when_to_seek_help: If exposed to contaminated water and develop fever or jaundice.

Rabies.description: Rabies is a deadly virus spread to people from the saliva of infected animals, usually through a bite.
Rabies.recommendations: Post-exposure prophylaxis with vaccine and immunoglobulin. Immediate treatment essential.
Rabies.when_to_seek_help: Immediate after animal bite or scratch.

Conjunctivitis (Eye Flu).description: Conjunctivitis is inflammation of the conjunctiva, often due to infection or allergies.
Conjunctivitis (Eye Flu).recommendations: Artificial tears, cold compresses. Antibiotics for bacterial type.
Conjunctivitis (Eye Flu).when_to_seek_help: If vision changes, severe pain, or symptoms persist.

Rotavirus Infection.description: Rotavirus is a virus that causes severe diarrhea among infants and young children.
Rotavirus Infection.when_to_seek_help: If signs of dehydration in children.

COPD.description: COPD is a chronic inflammatory lung disease that causes obstructed airflow from the lungs.
COPD.when_to_seek_help: If symptoms worsen suddenly or breathing becomes very difficult.

Bronchitis.description: Bronchitis is inflammation of the bronchial tubes, often caused by viruses or irritants.
Bronchitis.recommendations: Rest, fluids, cough medicine. Antibiotics if bacterial.
Bronchitis.when_to_seek_help: If cough lasts more than 3 weeks or is accompanied by high fever.

Hypertension.description: Hypertension is persistently high blood pressure that can lead to heart disease and stroke.
Hypertension.recommendations: Lifestyle changes, medications like ACE inhibitors.
Hypertension.when_to_seek_help: If blood pressure is very high or with symptoms like chest pain.

Diabetes Type 1.description: Type 1 diabetes is an autoimmune condition where the pancreas produces little or no insulin.
Diabetes Type 1.recommendations: Insulin therapy, blood sugar monitoring, healthy diet.
Diabetes Type 1.when_to_seek_help: If blood sugar is too high or low, or symptoms of ketoacidosis.

Diabetes Type 2.description: Type 2 diabetes is a condition where the body becomes resistant to insulin or doesn't produce enough.
Diabetes Type 2.recommendations: Lifestyle changes, medications like metformin, monitoring.
Diabetes Type 2.when_to_seek_help: If symptoms of high blood sugar or complications like neuropathy.

Hyperthyroidism.description: Hyperthyroidism is an overactive thyroid gland producing too much thyroid hormone.
Hyperthyroidism.when_to_seek_help: If symptoms like rapid heart rate or extreme weight loss.

Hypothyroidism.description: Hypothyroidism is an underactive thyroid gland not producing enough thyroid hormone.
Hypothyroidism.when_to_seek_help: If symptoms persist or worsen despite treatment.

Vitamin D Deficiency.description: Vitamin D deficiency occurs when the body doesn't get enough vitamin D from sunlight or diet.
Vitamin D Deficiency.recommendations: Vitamin D supplements, sun exposure, diet rich in vitamin D.
precautions: Eat fatty fish and fortified foods
Vitamin D Deficiency.when_to_seek_help: If symptoms like bone pain or frequent infections.

Vitamin B12 Deficiency.description: Vitamin B12 deficiency can lead to anemia and neurological problems, often due to poor diet or absorption issues.
Vitamin B12 Deficiency.recommendations: B12 supplements or injections, diet with animal products or fortified foods.
Vitamin B12 Deficiency.when_to_seek_help: If neurological symptoms like tingling or memory loss.

Anemia.description: Anemia is a condition in which you lack enough healthy red blood cells to carry adequate oxygen to your body's tissues.
Anemia.recommendations: Iron supplements, diet rich in iron, treat underlying cause.
Anemia.when_to_seek_help: If severe fatigue or chest pain.

Obesity.description: Obesity is excessive body fat that increases the risk of health problems.
Obesity.recommendations: Diet, exercise, behavior changes, medications or surgery for severe cases.
Obesity.when_to_seek_help: If BMI over 30 or with related health issues.

PCOS.description: Polycystic ovary syndrome is a hormonal disorder common among women of reproductive age.
PCOS.recommendations: Lifestyle changes, birth control pills, metformin.
PCOS.when_to_seek_help: If irregular periods or signs of androgen excess.

GERD.description: GERD is a chronic condition where stomach acid flows back into the esophagus, causing irritation.
GERD.recommendations: Lifestyle changes like avoiding trigger foods, elevating head during sleep, antacids or PPIs.
GERD.when_to_seek_help: If symptoms are frequent, severe, or accompanied by weight loss, vomiting blood, or difficulty swallowing.

Gastritis.description: Gastritis is inflammation of the stomach lining, often caused by H. pylori infection, NSAIDs, or alcohol.
Gastritis.recommendations: Antacids, PPIs, antibiotics if H. pylori positive, avoid irritants.
Gastritis.when_to_seek_help: If symptoms include vomiting blood, black stools, severe pain, or persist despite treatment.

Peptic Ulcer.description: Peptic ulcers are open sores that develop on the inside lining of the stomach and the upper portion of the small intestine.
Peptic Ulcer.recommendations: Antibiotics for H. pylori, PPIs to reduce acid, avoid NSAIDs.
Peptic Ulcer.when_to_seek_help: If you have severe pain, vomiting blood, black stools, or unexplained weight loss.

IBS.description: Irritable bowel syndrome is a common disorder that affects the large intestine, causing cramping, abdominal pain, bloating, gas, and diarrhea or constipation.
IBS.recommendations: Dietary changes (low FODMAP), fiber supplements, antispasmodics, stress management.
IBS.when_to_seek_help: If symptoms are severe, include blood in stool, unexplained weight loss, or nocturnal symptoms.

Ulcerative Colitis.description: Ulcerative colitis is an inflammatory bowel disease that causes long-lasting inflammation and ulcers in the digestive tract.
Ulcerative Colitis.recommendations: Anti-inflammatory drugs like mesalamine, corticosteroids, immunosuppressants, biologics, surgery if severe.
Ulcerative Colitis.when_to_seek_help: If you have severe diarrhea, blood in stool, severe pain, or signs of dehydration.

Crohnâs Disease.description: Crohn's disease is a type of inflammatory bowel disease that causes chronic inflammation of the gastrointestinal tract.
Crohnâs Disease.recommendations: Anti-inflammatory drugs, immunosuppressants, biologics, nutritional therapy, surgery.
Crohnâs Disease.when_to_seek_help: If symptoms flare with severe pain, diarrhea, fever, or weight loss.

Pancreatitis.description: Pancreatitis is inflammation of the pancreas, which can be acute or chronic.
Pancreatitis.recommendations: Hospitalization for IV fluids, pain control, fasting; treat underlying cause like gallstones or alcohol.
Pancreatitis.when_to_seek_help: Seek immediate care for severe abdominal pain radiating to back, especially with nausea and vomiting.

Jaundice.description: Jaundice is a yellow discoloration of the skin, mucous membranes, and whites of the eyes caused by elevated bilirubin levels.
Jaundice.recommendations: Treat underlying cause (e.g., hepatitis, obstruction); supportive care like hydration and nutrition.
Jaundice.when_to_seek_help: If jaundice is accompanied by abdominal pain, fever, confusion, or bleeding.

Constipation.description: Constipation is a condition in which there is difficulty in emptying the bowels, usually associated with hardened feces.
Constipation.recommendations: Increase fiber intake, stay hydrated, exercise, laxatives if needed.
Constipation.when_to_seek_help: If constipation lasts more than 3 weeks, accompanied by blood in stool, severe pain, or weight loss.

symptoms: inability to pass stool or gas
Bowel Obstruction.description: Bowel obstruction is a blockage that prevents food or liquid from passing through the small or large intestine.
Bowel Obstruction.recommendations: Immediate medical attention; NG tube decompression, IV fluids, surgery if needed.
Bowel Obstruction.when_to_seek_help: Seek emergency care for severe abdominal pain, vomiting, and no bowel movements.

Thalassemia.description: Thalassemia is an inherited blood disorder causing the body to have less hemoglobin than normal.
Thalassemia.recommendations: Regular blood transfusions, iron chelation therapy, bone marrow transplant for severe cases.
Thalassemia.when_to_seek_help: If symptoms of anemia worsen or complications like heart problems occur.

Sickle Cell Anemia.description: Sickle cell anemia is a group of inherited red blood cell disorders where red blood cells become hard and sticky, getting stuck in small blood vessels.
Sickle Cell Anemia.recommendations: Pain management, hydroxyurea, blood transfusions, bone marrow transplant.
Sickle Cell Anemia.when_to_seek_help: During pain crises, signs of infection, or stroke symptoms.

Cystic Fibrosis.description: Cystic fibrosis is a genetic disorder that affects the lungs, digestive system, and other organs, causing thick mucus buildup.
Cystic Fibrosis.recommendations: CFTR modulators, airway clearance techniques, antibiotics, nutritional support, lung transplant if severe.
Cystic Fibrosis.when_to_seek_help: If breathing worsens, increased cough, weight loss, or signs of infection.

Hemophilia.description: Hemophilia is a rare disorder in which blood doesn't clot normally because it lacks sufficient blood-clotting factors.
Hemophilia.recommendations: Replacement therapy with clotting factors, prophylactic treatment, gene therapy in some cases.
Hemophilia.when_to_seek_help: For any significant bleeding or injury.

Down Syndrome.description: Down syndrome is a genetic disorder caused by the presence of all or part of a third copy of chromosome 21.
Down Syndrome.recommendations: Early intervention therapies, regular medical screenings, educational support.
precautions: Routine health checks for heart, thyroid, hearing
Down Syndrome.when_to_seek_help: For any health concerns or developmental milestones not met.

Huntingtonâs Disease.description: Huntington's disease is a progressive brain disorder caused by a defective gene, leading to changes in the central area of the brain.
Huntingtonâs Disease.recommendations: Symptom management with medications, physical therapy, speech therapy, psychiatric care.
Huntingtonâs Disease.when_to_seek_help: If new symptoms appear or existing ones worsen.

Spondylosis.description: Spondylosis is age-related wear and tear affecting the spinal disks in the neck (cervical spondylosis) or lower back.
Spondylosis.recommendations: Pain medications, physical therapy, cervical collar, surgery if severe.
Spondylosis.when_to_seek_help: If pain radiates to arms or legs, or with weakness/numbness.

Sciatica.description: Sciatica refers to pain that travels along the path of the sciatic nerve from the lower back through the hips and down each leg.
Sciatica.recommendations: Pain relievers, physical therapy, steroid injections, surgery if persistent.
Sciatica.when_to_seek_help: If pain is severe, lasts more than a week, or accompanied by loss of bowel/bladder control.

Bursitis.description: Bursitis is inflammation of the bursae, small sacs filled with fluid that cushion the bones, tendons and muscles near joints.
Bursitis.recommendations: Rest, ice, compression, elevation (RICE), anti-inflammatory medications, aspiration if infected.
Bursitis.when_to_seek_help: If pain persists despite rest, or signs of infection like fever.

Tendonitis.description: Tendonitis is inflammation or irritation of a tendon, causing pain and tenderness just outside a joint.
Tendonitis.recommendations: RICE method, pain relievers, physical therapy, corticosteroid injections.
Tendonitis.when_to_seek_help: If pain doesn't improve with rest or interferes with daily activities.

Carpal Tunnel Syndrome.description: Carpal tunnel syndrome is a condition caused by pressure on the median nerve in the wrist, leading to pain, numbness, and tingling.
Carpal Tunnel Syndrome.recommendations: Wrist splinting, NSAIDs, corticosteroid injections, surgery if severe.
Carpal Tunnel Syndrome.when_to_seek_help: If symptoms persist or worsen, or if hand weakness develops.

Eczema Condition.description: Eczema is a condition that makes the skin red, inflamed, and itchy. It's common in children but can occur at any age.
Eczema Condition.recommendations: Moisturizers, topical corticosteroids, antihistamines, avoid triggers.
Eczema Condition.when_to_seek_help: If skin becomes infected (yellow crust, pus), or if symptoms are severe and uncontrolled.

Psoriasis.description: Psoriasis is a chronic autoimmune condition that speeds up the growth cycle of skin cells, causing buildup of cells on the surface.
Psoriasis.recommendations: Topical treatments, phototherapy, systemic medications, biologics.
precautions: Avoid triggers like stress and infections
Psoriasis.when_to_seek_help: If symptoms spread rapidly, joints are affected, or if treatments aren't working.

Acne.description: Acne is a skin condition that occurs when hair follicles become plugged with oil and dead skin cells, causing whiteheads, blackheads or pimples.
Acne.recommendations: Topical retinoids, benzoyl peroxide, antibiotics, hormonal treatments for women.
Acne.when_to_seek_help: If over-the-counter treatments don't work, severe acne, or scarring.

symptoms: loss of skin color in patches
loss of color in mucous membranes
Vitiligo.description: Vitiligo is a long-term condition where pale white patches develop on the skin due to lack of melanin.
Vitiligo.recommendations: Topical corticosteroids, calcineurin inhibitors, phototherapy, depigmentation, skin grafts.
Vitiligo.when_to_seek_help: If patches are spreading rapidly or causing distress.

Shingles.description: Shingles is a viral infection that causes a painful rash, caused by the varicella-zoster virus â the same virus that causes chickenpox.
Shingles.recommendations: Antiviral medications like acyclovir, pain relievers, calamine lotion, shingles vaccine.
precautions: Avoid contact with people who haven't had chickenpox
Shingles.when_to_seek_help: If rash is widespread, near eyes, or if pain is severe.

Urticaria (Hives).description: Urticaria, commonly known as hives, is a skin reaction that causes itchy welts ranging from small spots to large blotches.
Urticaria (Hives).recommendations: Antihistamines, avoid triggers, corticosteroids for severe cases.
Urticaria (Hives).when_to_seek_help: If hives last more than 6 weeks, accompanied by swelling of lips/tongue, or breathing difficulty.

Dermatitis.description: Dermatitis is a general term that describes a common skin irritation with many causes and forms.
Dermatitis.recommendations: Moisturizers, topical corticosteroids, identify and avoid irritants.
Dermatitis.when_to_seek_help: If symptoms persist, spread, or show signs of infection.

Melasma.description: Melasma is a common skin condition causing brown to gray-brown patches, usually on the face.
Melasma.recommendations: Sun protection, topical lightening agents like hydroquinone, chemical peels, laser therapy.
Melasma.when_to_seek_help: If condition affects self-esteem or doesn't improve with over-the-counter treatments.

Acute Kidney Injury.description: Acute kidney injury is a sudden episode of kidney failure or kidney damage that happens within a few hours or days.
Acute Kidney Injury.recommendations: Treat underlying cause, IV fluids, dialysis if necessary, avoid nephrotoxic drugs.
precautions: Avoid contrast dyes if at risk
Acute Kidney Injury.when_to_seek_help: Immediate if urine output decreases suddenly or swelling occurs.

Nephrotic Syndrome.description: Nephrotic syndrome is a kidney disorder that causes the body to excrete too much protein in the urine.
Nephrotic Syndrome.recommendations: Treat underlying cause, ACE inhibitors, diuretics, low-salt diet, statins.
Nephrotic Syndrome.when_to_seek_help: If swelling is severe or rapid weight gain occurs.

UTI.description: A urinary tract infection is an infection in any part of the urinary system â kidneys, ureters, bladder and urethra.
UTI.recommendations: Antibiotics, increased fluid intake, pain relievers.
UTI.when_to_seek_help: If symptoms persist after treatment, back pain, fever, or blood in urine.

Glomerulonephritis.description: Glomerulonephritis is inflammation of the tiny filters in the kidneys (glomeruli), which can impair kidney function.
Glomerulonephritis.recommendations: Treat underlying cause, blood pressure medications, immunosuppressants, dialysis if severe.
Glomerulonephritis.when_to_seek_help: If you notice blood in urine, swelling, or unexplained fatigue.

Cirrhosis.description: Cirrhosis is late-stage scarring of the liver caused by many forms of liver diseases and conditions.
Cirrhosis.recommendations: Treat underlying cause, lifestyle changes, medications for symptoms, liver transplant.
Cirrhosis.when_to_seek_help: If you develop jaundice, abdominal swelling, confusion, or bleeding.

Liver Cancer.description: Liver cancer is cancer that begins in the cells of the liver. Hepatocellular carcinoma is the most common type.
Liver Cancer.recommendations: Surgery, liver transplant, ablation, embolization, targeted therapy, immunotherapy.
Liver Cancer.when_to_seek_help: If you have persistent abdominal pain, unexplained weight loss, or jaundice.

Liver Failure.description: Liver failure occurs when large parts of the liver become damaged beyond repair and the liver is no longer able to function.
Liver Failure.recommendations: Treat underlying cause, supportive care, liver transplant.
Liver Failure.when_to_seek_help: Immediate for jaundice, confusion, or bleeding tendencies.

Fatty Liver.description: Fatty liver disease is the accumulation of fat in liver cells, which can progress to liver inflammation and damage.
Fatty Liver.recommendations: Weight loss, exercise, healthy diet, control diabetes and cholesterol.
Fatty Liver.when_to_seek_help: If you have risk factors and experience fatigue or abdominal discomfort.

Colorectal Cancer.description: Colorectal cancer starts in the colon or rectum, often developing from precancerous polyps.
Colorectal Cancer.recommendations: Colonoscopy for screening, surgery, chemotherapy, radiation therapy.
Colorectal Cancer.when_to_seek_help: If you notice blood in stool, persistent changes in bowel habits, or abdominal pain.

Breast Cancer.description: Breast cancer forms in the cells of the breasts, affecting both men and women but far more common in women.
Breast Cancer.recommendations: Mammography screening, surgery, radiation, chemotherapy, hormone therapy.
Breast Cancer.when_to_seek_help: If you find a lump or notice changes in your breast.

Cervical Cancer.description: Cervical cancer occurs in the cells lining the cervix â the lower part of the uterus that connects to the vagina.
Cervical Cancer.recommendations: Pap tests and HPV tests for screening, surgery, radiation, chemotherapy.
Cervical Cancer.when_to_seek_help: If you experience abnormal bleeding or persistent pelvic pain.
risk_factors: Long-term use of birth control pills

Lung Cancer.description: Lung cancer is a type of cancer that begins in the lungs and is the leading cause of cancer deaths worldwide.
Lung Cancer.recommendations: Surgery, chemotherapy, radiation therapy, targeted drug therapy, immunotherapy.
Lung Cancer.when_to_seek_help: If you have a new cough that doesn't go away, cough up blood, or experience shortness of breath.

symptoms: white or red patch in mouth
Oral Cancer.description: Oral cancer appears as a growth or sore in the mouth that does not go away, including cancers of the lips, tongue, cheeks, etc.
Oral Cancer.when_to_seek_help: If a mouth sore lasts more than 2 weeks or you notice unusual lumps.

Stomach Cancer.description: Stomach cancer, also known as gastric cancer, usually begins in the mucus-producing cells that line the stomach.
Stomach Cancer.recommendations: Surgery, chemotherapy, radiation therapy, targeted therapy.
Stomach Cancer.when_to_seek_help: If you have persistent stomach discomfort, unexplained weight loss, or vomiting blood.

Blood Cancer (Leukemia).description: Leukemia is cancer of the body's blood-forming tissues, including the bone marrow and the lymphatic system.
Blood Cancer (Leukemia).recommendations: Chemotherapy, targeted therapy, radiation therapy, stem cell transplant.
precautions: Avoid exposure to chemicals like benzene
Regular medical check-ups if at risk
Blood Cancer (Leukemia).when_to_seek_help: If you experience persistent fatigue, frequent infections, or unexplained bleeding.

Lymphoma.description: Lymphoma is cancer that begins in infection-fighting cells of the immune system, called lymphocytes.
Lymphoma.recommendations: Chemotherapy, radiation therapy, immunotherapy, stem cell transplant.
Lymphoma.when_to_seek_help: If you have persistent swollen lymph nodes without infection.
risk_factors: Certain infections like EBV or HIV

Aplastic Anemia.description: Aplastic anemia is a condition where the body stops producing enough new blood cells, leaving one fatigued and more prone to infections and uncontrolled bleeding.
Aplastic Anemia.recommendations: Blood transfusions, medications to stimulate bone marrow, stem cell transplant.
Aplastic Anemia.when_to_seek_help: If you experience severe fatigue, frequent infections, or unusual bleeding.

Thrombocytopenia.description: Thrombocytopenia is a condition characterized by abnormally low levels of platelets in the blood.
Thrombocytopenia.recommendations: Treat underlying cause, platelet transfusions if severe, medications like corticosteroids.
Thrombocytopenia.when_to_seek_help: If you have unexpected bruising or bleeding.

Parkinsonâs Disease.description: Parkinson's disease is a progressive nervous system disorder that affects movement, often including tremors.
Parkinsonâs Disease.recommendations: Levodopa, dopamine agonists, MAO-B inhibitors, deep brain stimulation, physical therapy.
Parkinsonâs Disease.when_to_seek_help: If you notice tremors, stiffness, or slowing of movement.

Alzheimerâs Disease.description: Alzheimer's disease is a progressive disorder that causes brain cells to waste away and die, leading to continuous decline in thinking, behavioral and social skills.
Alzheimerâs Disease.recommendations: Cholinesterase inhibitors, memantine, cognitive training, supportive care.
Alzheimerâs Disease.when_to_seek_help: If memory loss disrupts daily life or other cognitive changes occur.

Insomnia.description: A common sleep disorder that makes it hard to fall asleep, stay asleep, or get quality sleep.
Insomnia.recommendations: Sleep hygiene improvements, cognitive behavioral therapy for insomnia (CBT-I), possibly medication.
precautions: Exercise regularly but not before bed
Insomnia.when_to_seek_help: If insomnia affects your daily life, lasts more than a few weeks, or causes significant distress.
